page.title: 10LOCAL SERVICES RAVENGLASS
page.content: Within the village most services are provided,if only on a rather basic level due to low population numbers. There is a well-supported shop/post office, butcher and milkman.A local fisherman sails a small trawler from the harbour and sells fish directly from it(except when adverse publicity about Sellafield affects his business) In the summer there is a fish and chip shop and ice-cream van catering for the visitors as do the gift shops(in the village, at the castle and at the R&E Railway station).The coalmerchant, library,window cleaners,and refuse collectors regularly visit the village but the outlying farms are less well served. There is no doctor's surgery and the area is served by a medical centre at Seascale,7mls away,which operates an appointment system with medical staff all making home visits.
